Infante, Kiel Mico

Manila, Philippines · +63 9171277454 · micoinfante1997@gmail.com

I am an iOS Developer passionate in cross platform development and mobile security. I am aiming to help a company build and deploy applications that will be used by millions of users and solve real world problems while continuously honing my skills not only professionally but also as a person.

My Portfolio

ItadakiMonster

Restaurant Review App

ItadakiMonster/いただきモンスター is the first iOS project that I developed and deployed. The idea of the app is to provide customers a service to review restaurants in Japan using videos. It took me 6 months to fully deploy the app on the AppStore. I am also the one responsible for the maintenance and feature updates.

Another main feature of the app is the map. All the uploaded restaurant video reviews can be viewed in the map. These videos are pinned directly to the restaurant location. I used Google Maps SDK for displaying and getting the coordinates of the restaurants and pin the reviews to it.

The back-end of the app utilizes most of Firebase google technologies such as CloudFirestore, Firebase Storage, Firebase Deeplinks, Firebase functions, and Firebase Hosting.

The project director asked me to make a simple CMS with a feature that will let the admin select a best video for the month, data changes will sync to the iOS app. I used node.js together with Vue for the interface for this.
Technologies That I Used:

Swift, CocoaPods, Google Maps SDK, Firebase, Node.js, Vue.js, Google SDK, Facebook SDK, HTML, CSS, Javascript


Potchittona

Staff Caller App

Potchittona/ポチッとな aims to provide a better customer experience. Instead of traditionally calling a waiter or staff, you can just scan a qr-code on a restaurant table to notify them. Using this app will let the user know the current promos offered by the restaurant.

The iOS version is available on the appstore meanwhile, the android version is still in development but available for testing in limited functionalities.

I am the sole developer for the Project. The use-case is divided into 3: An Admin, Store Owner or Staff, and Customer. Administrative functions are handled on Web using Node.js together with Vue.js. Store Owner or Staff functionalities are only available on iPad Devices. Customers can use the app on their iPhone and Android devices.

Technologies That I Used:

Swift, CocoaPods, Firebase, Node.js, Vue.js, Google SDK, Facebook SDK, Kotlin, KotlinX, HTML, CSS, Javascript, Heroku




Ramen Sekai

Reward Points App

Ramen Sekai’s (ラーメン世界) main feature is a reward system. Customers can earn points by dining to restaurants. These points can be used to redeem coupons that are equivalent to a food in a specific restaurant. The app is available in both AppStore and Google PlayStore.

We are a team of two developers in this app. On the iOS App, I focused mainly on performance improvements and bug fixing. While I solely develop and deploy the android version on the Google PlayStore. The app works cross platform. Accounts created on iOS can be used on the Android version, vice versa.

This project also includes a Web CMS made entirely from Javascript, HTML, and CSS. All data coming from the CMS are sync to all devices.

Technologies That I Used:

Swift, CocoaPods, Google Maps SDK, Firebase, Node.js, Vue.js, Google SDK, Facebook SDK, HTML, CSS, Javascript
